reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick hits all the highlights and then some: Micky-mouse-eared deck-hands doing cat-shot dance moves; warplanes screaming off carrier decks; arrogant stick jockeys; beach volleyball; flat spins; and dogfight mayhem in the skies. Outstanding!
reviews.author: Mark Jackson

reviews.text:
Plays it safe.
[Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Andrea G. Bermejo

reviews.text: An implausible and forgettable retread of the original 1986 Top Gun.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: Maverick is both the perfect summer blockbuster and a masterclass in crowd-pleasing moviemaking. It’s the kind of edge-of-your-seat, fist-pumping, adrenaline rush of a spectacle that will gratify every one of your brain’s pleasure centres.
reviews.author: Laura Potier

reviews.text: A summer spectacular that proves that there’s still life left in the old ways, all while stoking, and satisfying, that familiar need for speed.
reviews.author: Nick Schager

reviews.text: You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, you’ll gasp and your heart will race.
reviews.author: Dulcie Pearce

reviews.text: I felt like i was in a jet in the air. It feels so much more visceral, so much faster, so much more dangerous.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: Tom Cruise revisits his eighties glory in a spectacular sequel. Top Gun: Maverick tells a thrilling new story while capturing the jet-fueled spirit of the classic original. The film boldly embraces practical visual effects in an era defined by CGI.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is an uninspired, outdated retread of 1986’s Top Gun, but with more implausible scenarios and with no women in military leadership positions ... Top Gun: Maverick, just like its main character, is stuck in a rut of reliving past glories.
reviews.author: Carla Hay

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is a blistering piece of pop art, an all-timer Dad movie stealth masterpiece, and maybe the ultimate legacy sequel.
reviews.author: Matt Lynch

reviews.text: I folded my arms and prepared for the worst. Two hours later, I was scribbling down words like “Whoa!”, “Exciting!” and “Bullseye!!”
reviews.author: Charlotte O'Sullivan

reviews.text: A much better film than its predecessor was, and much better than it needs to be overall.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: Tom Cruise has given us all a proud, defiant Dad Movie for men in their 50s. It's a reasonably effective action movie with reasonably exciting dogfights that sends you home going, "Well, that was exactly what I expected."
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: With music by Lady Gaga and Hans Zimmer, action scenes tailor-made for hulking IMAX screens, and Cruise flaunting it in a white naval uniform, it’s Top Gun dialled up to Mach 10.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: The conflict between two pilots remains intact, and the veterans who teach Cruise secrets about life and responsibility return... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Loser

reviews.text: The best legacy sequel to a single movie. One still can debate Creed, Cobra Kai or The Force Awakens, but each had entire franchises upon which to draw.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: Maverick is not the type of movie you wait around for until it’s on cable: It’s an adrenaline-pumping event worth getting off the La-Z-Boy to experience.
reviews.author: Miles Surrey

reviews.text: It makes the act of being a good movie look like the easiest thing in the world, with director Joseph Kosinski showing off everything he's got.
reviews.author: Emma Stefansky

reviews.text: See it on the biggest screen possible. Then see it again.
reviews.author: Kevin Maher

reviews.text: This is a worthy, often exemplary follow-up to the 1986 classic. It’s everything a summer movie should be.
reviews.author: Johnny Oleksinski

reviews.text: Somehow, "Maverick" manages to recycle those latter beats -- with an exceptionally well cast class of new pilots -- and still feel contemporary, all while approximating the old-fashioned virtues of the kind of movies that flourished in the '80s .
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: Satisfying sequel hits nearly all the marks while outdoing the original.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: More grown-up, more generous, and more lighthearted.
reviews.author: Oli Welsh

reviews.text: Top Gun 2 reboots the original film's heart-pounding aerial action, infectiously cheesy character drama and don't-think-too-hard-about-it military fetishism in a winning spectacle of cinematic escapism.
reviews.author: Richard Trenholm

reviews.text: Tom Cruise's 'Top Gun: Maverick' is an audio/visual treat and generally well-made summer blockbuster even as it becomes a 'Rise Of Skywalker'-style nostalgic ode to itself.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: Overall, a stunning piece of filmmaking and the perfect summer blockbuster for Memorial Day Weekend. Cruise, Kosinski & McQuarrie manage to recreate the feel of the original film while also updating it with a very modern - and thrilling - third act.
reviews.author: Grace Randolph

reviews.text: A breathless, gravity and logic-defying sequel.
reviews.author: Tomris Laffly

reviews.text: From beginning to end, there was nothing that happened that I could not anticipate, either in the flow of storytelling or from the idea of the movie I had before I sat down in a movie theater.
reviews.author: David Poland

reviews.text: Like its eponymous ace, it’s a dying breed, but there’s no way it’s going out in gasps or sputters. Not while Tom Cruise still draws breath.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Zhang

reviews.text: “Top Gun: Maverick,” a film that, thanks to advances in modern technology, outstrips its predecessor in nearly every capacity. The dogfights are breathtaking, the action sequences ungodly, and the need for speed is more urgent than ever.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: The ultimate Gen X Dad fantasy, in which a 50-something gets to outsmart and outperform the younger generation’s best and brightest.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is the definition of an exciting summer blockbuster.
reviews.author: Max Covill

reviews.text: Is 'Top Gun: Maverick' the movie that will mark a generation? No. Its predecessor will always hold that title. Is it a fun Hollywood film? Absolutely. Does it have substance? Not really.
reviews.author: Catalina Combs

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is pure movie magic that accomplishes the rare feat of improving upon the original.
reviews.author: Jeff Nelson

reviews.text: A textbook example of how to make a sequel.
reviews.author: Mark Kennedy

reviews.text: If this doesn't bring people back to theaters, nothing will.
reviews.author: Roger Friedman

reviews.text: Welcome back to the Military Industrial Oedipal Complex.
reviews.author: Stephen Dalton

reviews.text: This cinematic spectacle starts by paying homage to the original movie — with the notes of the “Top Gun Anthem” — and it never stops. If you liked Top Gun, you’ll enjoy Top Gun: Maverick thoroughly. All the ingredients of the original movie are there.
reviews.author: Patricia Puentes

reviews.text: What's not to love about a one of the greatest movie stars of all time refusing to be grounded and, instead, fully embracing the effects-driven era as his own? (Maybe the rotten script, but still)
reviews.author: J. Don Birnam

reviews.text: Teller and Powell are breezily appealing, actors at the apex of their youth and beauty, though the movie still belongs in almost every scene to Cruise.
reviews.author: Leah Greenblatt

reviews.text: Kosinski and co deliver all the Top Gun feels and then some: slick visuals, crew camaraderie, thrilling aerial action, a surprising emotional wallop and, in Tom Cruise, a magnetic movie-star performance as comforting as an old leather jacket.
reviews.author: Ian Freer

reviews.text: It’s a fresh-faced gloss on the original... powered, like the original, by a star who’ll simply never stop being a star.
reviews.author: K. Austin Collins

reviews.text: Now I want to see [Cruise] take on a sequel to Risky Business and do the underpants dance again.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Ridiculous and often ridiculously entertaining...
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: Like Maverick implores his pilots, you think in this world, you're dead. 'Top Gun: Maverick' requires you to let go of good taste and instead enjoy the flight into fantasy. If that happens, it'll take your breath away.
reviews.author: Brian Lloyd

reviews.text: One of the greatest, oft-overlooked skills [Tom Cruise] has developed over his decade-spanning career is how to internalize the weight of time, a factor crucial to Top Gun: Maverick’s ethos.
reviews.author: Conor O'Donnell

reviews.text: In short, Top Gun: Maverick is the most fun I’ve had watching a big dumb Hollywood blockbuster for a while.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is good ol' cheesy as hell, silly-heroic entertainment with mile-high enthusiasm — a welcome throwback to simpler cinematic times.
reviews.author: Matt Donato

reviews.text: The sequel follows the original beat for beat, to a degree that’s almost comical. And yet, as formulaic as it is, there’s no denying that it delivers in terms of both nostalgia and reinvention.
reviews.author: David Rooney

reviews.text: An expertly crafted, thunderously enjoyable and surprisingly emotional blockbuster.
reviews.author: Jamie Graham

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is as thrilling as blockbusters get.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: Tops the original in every way imaginable, from an all-knowing performance for the ages from Cruise to its highly emotional storyline, “take my breath away” aerial sequences and just about anything else you want from a studio blockbuster.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick isn’t just one of the best blockbusters of the year – it’s one of the best sequels of all time.
reviews.author: Cameron Frew

reviews.text: In the vacuum of Maverick’s 130 minute run, a disarming wistfulness, and a friendliness, give interesting shape to what could have been mere pointless rehash.
reviews.author: Richard Lawson

reviews.text: Top Gun Maverick has everything you want from a sequel and still works as a standalone film – a miraculous feat, achieved.
reviews.author: Gabriella Geisinger

reviews.text: It’s crammed with images you didn’t know you were desperate to see until the second you see them.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: Kosinski may not be able to match Tony Scott’s formalist bravado, but he makes up for it with speed, clarity, and a moral imperative to push the limits of what seems possible.
reviews.author: David Ehrlich

reviews.text: Tom Cruise is back in the cockpit and we’re all the better for it; Top Gun: Maverick is the definitive blockbuster of our times.
reviews.author: Maria Lattila

reviews.text: Whether you’re feeling the need for speed for the first time or haven’t lost that loving feeling since '86, the Danger Zone is still a pretty spectacular place to visit.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: Turns out we need Maverick now more than ever.  optional screen reader
reviews.author: Peter Debruge

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is a rare sequel that is not only better than the original but retroactively makes Top Gun's story altogether deeper.
reviews.author: Ben Kendrick

reviews.text: If you haven’t been to the movies in a while, “Top Gun: Maverick” is a way to get back in. It’s pretty much what “going to the movies” is all about.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is what you want out of big-budget summer blockbusters with insane cinematography and directing that you're going to feel like you're in the cockpit of a fighter plane.
reviews.author: Kaitlyn Booth

reviews.text: This lega-sequel builds on the groundwork laid by its predecessor, delivering riveting character drive as well as breathtaking, big screen Movie Moments. The new crew fuses the past with the present, making it a poignant, powerfully potent thrill ride.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: A thrilling big-screen experience that would do Tony Scott proud. Worth the very long wait.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: Sumptuous in its visual splendour and awe-inspiring in execution, it is unlike anything we have seen before, Top Gun: Maverick is the most exhilarating and spectacular blockbusters of its kind.
reviews.author: Scott Davis

reviews.text: The film is the rare sequel that outdoes the original in every way, delivering the ultimate theatrical experience that will have audiences convinced they've just hit crossed Mach 5 themselves.
reviews.author: Spencer Perry

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick improves upon the original in every conceivable way, and does so in a way that might make this one of the greatest sequels ever made.
reviews.author: Ross Bonaime

reviews.text: It’s been a long time since I’ve seen a movie that made me think “How did they do that?”
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: Tom Cruise Takes Audiences On A Satisfying Trip Back To The Danger Zone.
reviews.author: Ben Pearson

reviews.text: It’s rare when a sequel not only fully exceeds expectations but, at least to me, is just so much better than its predecessor, and that’s the case with Maverick.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is so much better than it arguably has any right to be. One of the year’s best films so far, it’s a sequel that’s an improvement upon the original in nearly every manner.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: Top Gun Maverick is the definition of “they don’t make them like this anymore." A throwback to when summer blockbusters mattered; the perfect mix of heart, spectacle, and action.
reviews.author: EJ Moreno

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick took my breath away. An adrenaline rush tailor-made for the summer blockbuster season. It gives cinephiles jaw-dropping aerial combat sequences, and packs an emotional punch that makes Top Gun: Maverick the event of the summer.
reviews.author: David Gonzalez

reviews.text: You will want to high five someone on the way out.
reviews.author: Philip De Semlyen

reviews.text: Much like Ethan Hunt in the Mission: Impossible movies, Cruise embodies the character of Maverick with all his bravado, insecurities and skeletons.
reviews.author: Allison Rose

reviews.text: It's a triumphant example of blockbuster filmmaking, proving that there are still boundaries to be pushed and elements from the past worth preserving.
reviews.author: Matt Neglia

reviews.text: The movie has visceral thrills, massive peril, hard-fought and earned victories, but also captivating romance, searing drama, big emotional stakes, heart, soul, and poignant pathos.
reviews.author: Rodrigo Perez

reviews.text: Top Gun: Maverick is the must-see cinematic experience of the year! Packed with jaw-dropping aerial sequences, genuine heart, and one of the best performances of Tom Cruise's career, this is the theatrical experience you've been waiting for.
reviews.author: Rohan Patel

reviews.text: The film fully surrenders to the grandiose fun that’s marked the best of Tom Cruise’s recent star vehicles and reaffirms Joseph Kosinski as a blockbuster craftsman par excellence.
reviews.author: Jake Cole

synopsis:
After more than thirty years of service as one of the Navy’s top aviators, Pete “Maverick” Mitchell (Tom Cruise) is where he belongs, pushing the envelope as a courageous test pilot and dodging the advancement in rank that would ground him. When he finds himself training a detachment of Top Gun graduates for a specialized mission the likes of which no living pilot has ever seen, Maverick encounters Lt. Bradley Bradshaw (Miles Teller), call sign: “Rooster,” the son of Maverick’s late friend and Radar Intercept Officer Lt. Nick Bradshaw, aka “Goose”.

Facing an uncertain future and confronting the ghosts of his past, Maverick is drawn into a confrontation with his own deepest fears, culminating in a mission that demands the ultimate sacrifice from those who will be chosen to fly it.
